Because detainers are requests, local police departments are liable for choosing to honor them.
Local governments have paid a heavy price for mistakenly placing their trust in ICE.
Federal courts have affirmed that detainers are new arrests that, w/p a determination of probable cause, violate one's constitutional rights
ICE claims that detainers are backed by probable cause. Often, they are not.
These requests from ICE can often lead to illegal arrests and the violation of a person’s constitutional rights.
A "detainer" from ICE is a request to hold someone in jail, often longer than  local law enforcement agency is legally allowed.

FISA, passed by Congress in 1978, allows the government to surveil foreign powers & their agents w/approval of secret court.
